rawmessage: You are planning your trip in Cambridge
You are looking for a place to dine. The restaurant should be in the south and should be in the expensive price range
The restaurant should serve traditional food
If there is no such restaurant, how about one that serves mexican food
Once you find the restaurant you want to book a table for 6 people at 14:00 on wednesday
Make sure you get the reference number
You are also looking for a train. The train should leave after 15:45 and should leave on thursday
The train should depart from cambridge and should go to london kings cross
Once you find the train you want to make a booking for the same group of people
Make sure you get the reference number
data.message:
You are planning your trip in Cambridge.
You are looking for a place to dine. The restaurant should be in the south and should be in the expensive price range.
The restaurant should serve traditional food.
If there is no such restaurant, how about one that serves mexican food.
Once you find the restaurant you want to book a table for 6 people at 14:00 on wednesday.
Make sure you get the reference number.
You are also looking for a train. The train should leave after 15:45 and should leave on thursday.
The train should depart from cambridge and should go to london kings cross.
Once you find the train you want to make a booking for the same group of people.
Make sure you get the reference number

corpususer.utterance: I want a place to dine in the south that is expensive.
We have several options that include Chinese, Indian, Italian, and Mexican. Which one do you prefer?
I'm looking for a restaurant serves traditional food. Are there any nearby?
There are no restaurants in the south serving traditional food. Would you prefer something different?
How about Mexican food?  Can you check on that for me?
Sure! We have the Chiquito Restaurant Bar located in the south serving Mexican food.  Would you like to make a reservation?
Yes please. I need reservation for 6 people at 1400 on wednesday.
I have a table for 6 reserved for you on Wednesday at 14:00.  They will hold the table for 15 minutes.  Your reference number is DKBLDY07
Thanks. I also need to find a train for Thursday.
OK, what are your departure and arrival stations, and what time of day would you like to travel?
It should leave after 15:45 on thursday.
Sure, which stations will you be departing from and arriving to?
I am departing from cambridge and arriving in london kings cross.
Ok, leaving after 15:45 on thursday we have Train TR1791 from cambridge to london kings cross	leaving at 17:00 and arriving at 17:51. Shall I book it, if so for how many?
That will work. For six people as well. Please make sure I receive the reference number.

Booking was successful, the total fee is 141.6 GBP payable at the station .
Reference number is : V1YVJYN8. Can I help with anything else today?
That's all I need for today, thanks for your help!
Goodbye, enjoy the rest of your day.

function.description: Extract structured details for restaurant, hotel, or flight-related queries.

status.description: Defines the type of action. Possible values: 'follow-up' (requires a response), 'db-query' (fetches data from a database), 'validate-booking' (checks booking status).

oneOf.title: FollowUpDetails
oneOf.description: Details for a follow-up action, containing a message.
Details for a database query action.

arriveby.description: An object representing arrival time conditions with an operator and a time in HH:MM format.

operator.description: A comparison operator indicating the condition (e.g., '<=' means arriving by or before a time).

value.description: A time string formatted as HH:MM (24-hour format).

leaveat.description: An object representing departure time conditions with an operator and a time in HH:MM format.

operator.description: A comparison operator indicating the condition (e.g., '<=' means departing by or before a time).

value.description: A time string formatted as HH:MM (24-hour format).

oneOf.title: DBQueryDetails

oneOf.description: Details for validating a booking status.
oneOf.title: ValidateBookingDetails

prompts.prompt_a:
ROLE: You are a user simulator tasked with interacting naturally with a dialogue system.

TASK:
You are planning your trip in Cambridge.
You are looking for a place to dine. The restaurant should be in the south and should be in the expensive price range.
The restaurant should serve traditional food.
If there is no such restaurant, how about one that serves mexican food.
Once you find the restaurant you want to book a table for 6 people at 14:00 on wednesday.
Make sure you get the reference number.
You are also looking for a train. The train should leave after 15:45 and should leave on thursday.
The train should depart from cambridge and should go to london kings cross.
Once you find the train you want to make a booking for the same group of people.
Make sure you get the reference number

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Communicate naturally by expressing preferences, asking clarifying questions, and making decisions as needed. 
2. Maintain a polite and conversational tone.
3. Respond strictly based on the dialogue system's response. Do not add logic or interpretation beyond what is explicitly stated in the TASK.
4. Ensure that names and terms remain exactly as provided in the input, without any added or altered punctuation (e.g., do not add apostrophes, hyphens, or other symbols). Maintain strict adherence to the original formatting.
5. Once the dialogue system completes the task and provides all the required details, reply with "DONE". No additional text should follow.
6. Do not simulate or act as the dialogue system; only interact with it.
7. Keep responses concise and focused, avoiding unnecessary elaboration or overly conversational tone.


OUTPUT FORMAT:
1. Interaction: Respond appropriately using only the dialogue system's response and the information under TASK.
2. Task Completion: Reply with "DONE"

Lets begin
prompts.turn_prompt_a:
1. Continue interacting until the task is complete.
2. Once the dialogue system has completed the task, reply with "DONE".
3. Do not simulate or act as the dialogue system; only interact with it.
4. When responding to the dialogue system's queries, use only the information provided under TASK.
5. Ensure that names and terms remain exactly as provided in the input, without any added or altered punctuation (e.g., do not add apostrophes, hyphens, or other symbols). Maintain strict adherence to the original formatting. If there is a conflict between TASK and the dialogue systemâ€™s details, always follow the TASK as the final authority.

TASK:
Use the following details to provide information during the conversation:
You are planning your trip in Cambridge.
You are looking for a place to dine. The restaurant should be in the south and should be in the expensive price range.
The restaurant should serve traditional food.
If there is no such restaurant, how about one that serves mexican food.
Once you find the restaurant you want to book a table for 6 people at 14:00 on wednesday.
Make sure you get the reference number.
You are also looking for a train. The train should leave after 15:45 and should leave on thursday.
The train should depart from cambridge and should go to london kings cross.
Once you find the train you want to make a booking for the same group of people.
Make sure you get the reference number

Here is the dialogue system's response:
prompts.prompt_b:
ROLE: You are a specialized booking assistant interacting with a human user by generating structured JSON responses. Your role is to process user requests and ensure successful task completion while maintaining a professional, helpful tone.

TASK: Assist the user conversationally by:
1. Extracting key details needed for the task (e.g., domain, date, time, location).
2. Cross-referencing user-provided information with the database to find relevant matches.
3. Generating responses to gather missing or unclear information or to provide the booking status.
4. Consolidating all extracted and clarified details for booking finalization.
5. Validating the booking and generating confirmation details.
6. Keeping responses concise and focused, avoiding unnecessary elaboration or overly conversational tone.
7. All responses must strictly adhere to the schema. Include all required fields.


USER REQUEST:

rawmessage: You are traveling to Cambridge and looking forward to try local restaurants
You are looking for a restaurant. The restaurant should be in the centre and should serve chinese food
The restaurant should be in the expensive price range
Once you find the restaurant you want to book a table for 7 people at 15:00 on thursday
If the booking fails how about 14:00
Make sure you get the reference number
You are also looking for a train. The train should leave on friday and should go to kings lynn
The train should depart from cambridge and should leave after 15:15
Once you find the train you want to make a booking for the same group of people
Make sure you get the reference number
data.message:
You are traveling to Cambridge and looking forward to try local restaurants.
You are looking for a restaurant. The restaurant should be in the centre and should serve chinese food.
The restaurant should be in the expensive price range.
Once you find the restaurant you want to book a table for 7 people at 15:00 on thursday.
If the booking fails how about 14:00.
Make sure you get the reference number.
You are also looking for a train. The train should leave on friday and should go to kings lynn.
The train should depart from cambridge and should leave after 15:15.
Once you find the train you want to make a booking for the same group of people.
Make sure you get the reference number

corpususer.utterance: I'm looking for a restaurant that serves chinese food in the centre of town.
How about the Jinling Noodle Bar. I can reserve a table for you.
Is it expensive? I would like the restaurant to be expensive.
It is not, but the Ugly Duckling is. Would you like more information on that restaurant?
Please book a table for 7 at Ugly Duckling.
I'd be happy to! What day and time would you like for your reservation?
Please book the reservation for Thursday at 3:00pm and please provide me with a reference number.
Great it's all set RAQ4F5LX is the reference number
I'm also looking for a train to leave on Friday and go to Kings Lynn
Where are you departing from?
I'll be departing from Cambridge and want to leave after 15:15.
There's a train that leaves at 16:11 and arrives at 16:58. The price is 9.80 pounds. Would you like to book it?
Yes please, for the same number of people. Can you also get the reference number?
Your train tickets have been booked on train TR1911. Your reference number is 4BLMS5KM. Is there anything else I can assist you with?
I believe that's everything I needed for now. Thanks!
Pleasure serving you!

rawmessage: You are traveling to Cambridge and looking forward to try local restaurants
You are looking for a train. The train should go to london kings cross and should leave on thursday
The train should leave after 19:45 and should depart from cambridge

data.message:
You are traveling to Cambridge and looking forward to try local restaurants.
You are looking for a train. The train should go to london kings cross and should leave on thursday.
The train should leave after 19:45 and should depart from cambridge.
Once you find the train you want to make a booking for 5 people.
Make sure you get the reference number.
You are also looking for a particular restaurant. Its name is called la tasca.
Once you find the restaurant you want to book a table for the same group of people at 15:30 on the same day.
Make sure you get the reference number

corpususer.utterance: I travelling to Cambridge and am looking for a train  to the London Kings Cross station leaving on Thursday.
Where will you be traveling from on Thursday?
I want to depart from Cambridge after 19:45 and arrive at london kings cross.
TR0720 departs cambridge at 21:00 on Thursday, heading to london kings cross. How many tickets do you need?
I would like to book 4.  Can you tell me the price for each ticket before I  book them?
The cost for one ticket is 23.60 pounds.
I would actually like to book 5 people and would like to know the reference number for the tickets and the address of La Tasca restaurant.
Booking was successful, your reference number is D8JELRTU. La tasca is located at 14 -16 Bridge Street. Would you like a reservation?
Yes please. Can I book a table for five people?
I'd be happy to book that for you, what day and time would you like that reservation for?
I would like to book it for 5 people at 15:30 on the same day as the train, Thursday. Can I also get the reference number for that as well?
The table will be reserved for 15 minutes. Your reference number is XN08QJTD.
Thank you very much!
Is there anything else I can help you with today, or are you all set?
That's all, thank you.
Thank you for using our system!

rawmessage: You are planning your trip in Cambridge
You are looking for a particular restaurant. Its name is called shiraz restaurant
Once you find the restaurant you want to book a table for 5 people at 19:45 on saturday
Make sure you get the reference number
You are also looking for a train. The train should go to cambridge and should depart from birmingham new street

data.message:
You are planning your trip in Cambridge.
You are looking for a particular restaurant. Its name is called shiraz restaurant.
Once you find the restaurant you want to book a table for 5 people at 19:45 on saturday.
Make sure you get the reference number.
You are also looking for a train. The train should go to cambridge and should depart from birmingham new street.
The train should be on the same day as the restaurant booking and should arrive by 13:15.
Once you find the train you want to make a booking for the same group of people.
Make sure you get the reference number

corpususer.utterance: I am planning a trip in Cambridge
What can I help you with?
I need to reserve a table at shiraz, can you help me?
I sure can. Shiraz is an expensive mediterranean place in the centre of town. What day would you like your reservation?
I need the reservation for Saturday.
Ok, i am getting the info up now, how many people will this be for and what time?
There will be 5 of us and 19:45 would be great.
I have made your reservation. Your reference number is T9VU6COP.
I also need to book a train.
Great! Where are you going, and when would you like to arrive?
We are departing from Birmingham New Street and going to Cambridge.
Great, what day and time would you like to leave?
I want to travel on saturday and arrive by 13:15 please
Okay, I see 7 trains here matching your needs. Would you like me to reserve tickets?
Yes choose the arrival time closest to 13:15 and book that train for 5 people. Then give me the reference number
Okay, you are booked and reference number is QSA8VDXW
Thank you so much.
Is there anything else I can help you with?
No, that will be all. Thanks.
Your welcome enjoy your trip

prompts.prompt_a:
ROLE: You are a user simulator tasked with interacting naturally with a dialogue system.

TASK:
You are planning your trip in Cambridge.
You are looking for a particular restaurant. Its name is called shiraz restaurant.
Once you find the restaurant you want to book a table for 5 people at 19:45 on saturday.
Make sure you get the reference number.
You are also looking for a train. The train should go to cambridge and should depart from birmingham new street.
The train should be on the same day as the restaurant booking and should arrive by 13:15.
Once you find the train you want to make a booking for the same group of people.
Make sure you get the reference number

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Communicate naturally by expressing preferences, asking clarifying questions, and making decisions as needed. 
2. Maintain a polite and conversational tone.
3. Respond strictly based on the dialogue system's response. Do not add logic or interpretation beyond what is explicitly stated in the TASK.
4. Ensure that names and terms remain exactly as provided in the input, without any added or altered punctuation (e.g., do not add apostrophes, hyphens, or other symbols). Maintain strict adherence to the original formatting.
5. Once the dialogue system completes the task and provides all the required details, reply with "DONE". No additional text should follow.
6. Do not simulate or act as the dialogue system; only interact with it.
7. Keep responses concise and focused, avoiding unnecessary elaboration or overly conversational tone.


OUTPUT FORMAT:
1. Interaction: Respond appropriately using only the dialogue system's response and the information under TASK.
2. Task Completion: Reply with "DONE"

Lets begin
prompts.turn_prompt_a:
1. Continue interacting until the task is complete.
2. Once the dialogue system has completed the task, reply with "DONE".
3. Do not simulate or act as the dialogue system; only interact with it.
4. When responding to the dialogue system's queries, use only the information provided under TASK.
5. Ensure that names and terms remain exactly as provided in the input, without any added or altered punctuation (e.g., do not add apostrophes, hyphens, or other symbols). Maintain strict adherence to the original formatting. If there is a conflict between TASK and the dialogue systemâ€™s details, always follow the TASK as the final authority.

TASK:
Use the following details to provide information during the conversation:
You are planning your trip in Cambridge.
You are looking for a particular restaurant. Its name is called shiraz restaurant.
Once you find the restaurant you want to book a table for 5 people at 19:45 on saturday.
Make sure you get the reference number.
You are also looking for a train. The train should go to cambridge and should depart from birmingham new street.
The train should be on the same day as the restaurant booking and should arrive by 13:15.
Once you find the train you want to make a booking for the same group of people.
Make sure you get the reference number

Here is the dialogue system's response:
prompts.prompt_b:
ROLE: You are a specialized booking assistant interacting with a human user by generating structured JSON responses. Your role is to process user requests and ensure successful task completion while maintaining a professional, helpful tone.

TASK: Assist the user conversationally by:
1. Extracting key details needed for the task (e.g., domain, date, time, location).
2. Cross-referencing user-provided information with the database to find relevant matches.
3. Generating responses to gather missing or unclear information or to provide the booking status.
4. Consolidating all extracted and clarified details for booking finalization.
5. Validating the booking and generating confirmation details.
6. Keeping responses concise and focused, avoiding unnecessary elaboration or overly conversational tone.
7. All responses must strictly adhere to the schema. Include all required fields.


USER REQUEST:

rawmessage: You are planning your trip in Cambridge
You are looking for a train. The train should arrive by 16:00 and should leave on monday
The train should go to broxbourne and should depart from cambridge
Once you find the train you want to make a booking for 1 people
Make sure you get the reference number
You are also looking for a particular restaurant. Its name is called travellers rest
Once you find the restaurant you want to book a table for the same group of people at 13:00 on the same day
If the booking fails how about tuesday
Make sure you get the reference number
data.message:
You are planning your trip in Cambridge.
You are looking for a train. The train should arrive by 16:00 and should leave on monday.
The train should go to broxbourne and should depart from cambridge.
Once you find the train you want to make a booking for 1 people.
Make sure you get the reference number.
You are also looking for a particular restaurant. Its name is called travellers rest.
Once you find the restaurant you want to book a table for the same group of people at 13:00 on the same day.
If the booking fails how about tuesday.
Make sure you get the reference number

corpususer.utterance: Hello, I am looking for a train that arrives by 16:00 and leaves on monday.
There are multiple trains available to you. Where are you departing from and what is your destination please?
I want to broxbourne from cambridge.
We have trains leaving from 05:01 every hour until 14:01 that will get you to Broxbourne by 16:00.  What time would be more acceptable to you?

Once you find the train you want to make a booking for 1 people.
Make sure you get the reference number
The TR0796 train leaves Cambridge at 05:01 and arrives in Broxbourne 06:01.  The cost in 17.90 pounds.  Is this a good train for you?
Yes please. Please book a ticket for one person.
The booking was successful your reference number is  XUKSDFW4. Is there anything I can help with today?
Yes. I would like a restaurant for the same day. The name is Travellers rest.
Travellers restaurant is an expensive british restaurant in the west part of town. Is there anything else I can do for you?
Can you book that restaurant for me, for one person at 13:00?
Booking was successful. The table will be reserved for 15 minutes. Your reference number is : RYE38VWC.  Can I do anything else for you today?
That is all that I need. Thank you.
Thank you so much for calling Cambridge TownInfo centre! We hope you enjoy your time in our city!

statusmsg.welcome: Welcome to the $domain booking bot. Let me know, how can I help you?
statusmsg.usergoal:
Here is your goal:
Goal:
$goal

Begin your interaction with the bot to achieve the goal.
